author: John Auty
content: We used to see these beautifully shaped SL 7’s in Rotterdam but they had a reliabillity problem and we were much larger.Our Tokyo Bay class had 82000 shp to give 31 knots on trials in 1971 and carried 3000 teu’s.But fuel crisis in 1973 caused our 400 tons per day to mean dropping speed and eventual conversion to twin diesel.Was good to see the SL 7’s still working,our OCL ships are long gone.
